alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 9:41PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hamilton and northwestern Stanton Counties through 1015 PM CDT/915 PM MDT/... At 941 PM CDT/841 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Towner to near Coolidge to 15 miles northwest of The Saunders Elevator. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Syracuse and Coolidge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT/midnight MDT/ for southwestern Kansas.
